figure_2.caption: Fear-avoidance model adapted based on findings, with key to mixed-methods table

figure_1.title: Figure 1.
figure_1.caption: Bivariate correlations of the fear-avoidance model

claims.sentence: Below, we describe the measures that we used to represent the elements in fear-avoidance model (see Figure 2).
We then mapped these results onto the fear-avoidance model (using an alpha-numeric key) and added in novel elements and relationships based on our findings (see Figure 2).

Quantitative Findings: associations between elements of the fear-avoidance model
Figure 1 displays the bivariate correlations among adjacent elements of the fear-avoidance model (Figure 1).

Open in a new tab
Bivariate correlations of the fear-avoidance modelQualitative Findings
We identified 14 themes, each with several subthemes, that align with the relationships between elements of the fear-avoidance model (see Table 2 and Figure 2).
Quantitative findings revealed preliminary correlations that suggest that the fear-avoidance model applies to this population (see Figure 1).
